channel.title: KenSmith tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from KenSmith.

item.description: We don’t know who Cameron is. His robot blew into our yard, I guess. https://t.co/g5sP2ci3ZS

A fresh red radish, as heavy and as big around as an old silver dollar, eaten with a quick shake of salt. It's moist and peppery, crisp, and still warm from the soil. The flavor, not flattened by refrigeration, is the best I can remember in fifty years. Now, sixty [old FB post].

"We should claim that any movement preaching intolerance places itself outside the law and we should consider incitement to intolerance and persecution as criminal, in the same way as we should consider incitement to murder, or to kidnapping..as criminal." https://t.co/gLfGiB0GRv

One day later, at St. Patrick's County Park, the @MerlinBirdID app suggested we were hearing a good number of old familiar birds and at least two stand-outs. https://t.co/PUnz1BTxte https://t.co/tzl4LbOk3b
Near the end of my journey, I was distracted by the thought of a mango-colored banjo I could strum on the manor’s veranda.
My friend’s husband fell for a too-good-to-be-true investment scheme. After he died, when she was in her eighties, she went back to work. https://t.co/QndlnX0M3O
“On Sunday, there were at least another five mass shootings.” https://t.co/l0hUiKgew5
Walt Whitman, born on May 31, 1819. https://t.co/X7paginOfe
"As far as I know, the truth about America has never been taught in an American school, to American kids." https://t.co/Pk25VBIq61
Today, the @MerlinBirdID app said we probably heard these birds on Trail 4 at @INDNRstateparks's Potato Creek State Park in northern Indiana: https://t.co/RxYKxaf46B
I didn’t realize the pieces of fancy chocolate came wrapped with sayings and quotations. https://t.co/gpzuYv5TiD
“[And] the gun-worshippers went ahead and had their convention.” https://t.co/EvYPjzcN9b

From @nytDavidBrooks, an essay about why dogma isn't enough, why rote uses of religion aren't good enough, why moral decency is both within reach and different than we tend to think it is. https://t.co/lcaN7j9bGM https://t.co/xmlKiohVwn
In the shopping center, the bitcoin machine doesn’t obscure the market trend. https://t.co/VECsXChAQp
@SusanDebraBlum Many thanks…

Just like IN-2nd’s @RepWalorski / @JackieWalorski and Indiana’s @SenatorBraun, even this week Indiana’s @SenToddYoung has nothing constructive to say about gun violence or gun control. When it comes to saving the lives of school kids, they’re all three quite useless.
Just like IN-2nd’s @RepWalorski / @JackieWalorski, even this week Indiana’s @SenatorBraun has nothing constructive to say about gun violence or gun control. They’re both useless.
Even this week IN-2nd’s @RepWalorski / @JackieWalorski has nothing constructive to say about gun violence or gun control. She’s useless.
A surge of celebrations . . . My new radio piece is about to drop, as the young people say. https://t.co/A7JX9v3Wgx
Needs an update. Matt Reuter in the @NewYorker. https://t.co/WzBnhergPR
Need something done here in America? We’ll get right on it. Have your great-grandchildren check back in ninety years. https://t.co/1iKWVeqBwR

"This is a blog, therefore I am free to tell you, dear reader, about these events." "This is a blog, therefore I am obligated to tell you, dear reader, about these events." Both seem right to me. The tools free me, the genre compels me. Maybe that's it.

Putting a "like" on a tweet is a far milder act than retweeting. A "like" is roughly an approving nod to the tweet's writer from across the way. Probably no one else will notice. With a RT we stand before our friends and repeat the writer's words. [Still, it's just a tweet.]
Judging by her social media streams, IN-2nd’s @RepWalorski / @JackieWalorski has nothing specific, nothing useful to say about guns and gun violence in the U. S.

We often hear: “Gunman appears to have acted alone.” But that’s imprecise thinking. Culture cultivates and glamorizes male violence, legislators make guns easy to buy and mental health care hard to find, citizens fail to learn and practice effective activism, eg.
